page.title: 03WILDLIFE - ROYAL BIRKDALE 1
page.content: The course at the golf club is laid out on sand dune pasture.It is rich in wildlife and provides homes for a host of specialiased animals and plants. Most of the course is included in a site of Special Scientific Interest scheduled by the Nature Conservancy Council.Damp hollows (dune slacks) are found in some of the lower lying areas between the dune banks.These are usually dominated by a creeping willow but can also contain a wide variety of other plants including marsh,orchids, grass of Parnassus and many sedge and rush species.These wet slacks/ponds support one of the rarest animals in Britain,the natterjack toad.The yellow stripe along the centre of the back makes the toad easy to see and gives it its old English name "golden back" The Sefton coastdune area is probably the toad's main stronghold in Britain.
